data.title: Boys College Prep School in VA
meta_keywords: best boys prep schools near richmond va
boys prep school in Mid Atlantic
data.meta_description: Visiting Woodberry Forest School, a private boys prep school in Virginia for grades 9-12, is one of the most important steps in the admissions process.
data.text:
We are happy to have you on campus at any time. Some families prefer to visit when they can catch a sporting event or participate in a big weekend like our Episcopal High School rivalry weekend.

Please note that our fall visit calendar fills up quickly so we encourage you to reach out as soon as possible once you've found a weekend that will work for you.

Places of Interest Near Woodberry Forest School

Ash Lawn – Highland

(434) 293-8000

Home of James Monroe in Charlottesville.

Carter Mountain

(434) 977-1833

This orchard features a country store and winery in addition to being able to pick your own seasonal fruit.

Graves Mountain Lodge

(540) 923-4231

There is a cannery on site with fabulous jams, jellies and condiments. The lodge area also offers horseback riding, evening hayrides and fishing.

Grelen Downtown

www.themarketatgrelen.com/shop

(540) 308-7953

Grelen Downtown is a boutique gift shop featuring a curated gift selection for every occasion located on Main Street, Orange, VA.

The Market at Grelen

(540) 672-7268 for general information

The Market at Grelen is a European-style garden shop and cafe which also boasts 6 miles of free hiking trails, pick-your-own fruit (in season) and an event venue.

Michie Tavern

(434) 977-1234

Historic tavern and lodge with a restaurant, gift shop, general store and metal smith shop.

It is located a half mile below Monticello and next to Carter Mountain.

Monticello

(434) 984-9800

The home of Thomas Jefferson.

Montpelier

(540) 672-2728 x 450 for general information

Historic lifelong home of James Madison.

It is located 20 minutes from Woodberry.

City of Charlottesville

Detailed listings of Charlottesville area attractions along with an extensive calendar of events.

Town of Culpeper

Numerous antique and gift shops as well as tasty restaurants dot the town.

Historic Culpeper is located 18 miles north of Woodberry on Route 15.

Town of Gordonsville

Art galleries, gift and clothing shops as well as restaurants are located along the main street of the town. Historic Gordonsville is located about 20 minutes south of Woodberry on Route 15.

Town of Madison

https://madisonva.com

Paleo-Indians, the royal governor Alexander Spottswood and the Knights of the Golden Horseshoe, as well as Civil War Generals Stonewall Jackson and J. E. B. Stuart along with their men have all been visitors to Madison County. We are proud to invite you to this beautiful, historic and exciting region of Virginia. Let us help you plan your visit!

Town of Orange

Numerous antique and gift shops as well as tasty restaurants dot the town.

Orange is located 6 miles south of Woodberry on Route 15.

Virginia Wineries

Click on the tab for “Regions and AVA’s” and then click on the Monticello Wine Trail.

Featured wineries close to Woodberry include Barboursville, Early Mountain, Horton, Keswick, Prince Michel, and Veritas.

Yoder’s Country Market

540-948-3000

Yoder’s is a family run Amish market featuring a huge variety of home baked goods, bulk foods, spices and a deli. There is a barnyard where guests can feed the goats or just look at the turkeys, guineas and pheasants.

It is located about 10 minutes from Woodberry.
